result.execSummary:
All charges against Johnny Ray Lee in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnny Ray Lee is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Ray Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Johnny Ray Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Johnny Ray Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing today. Defendant wants to go forth with jury trial that is scheduled on 9-21-22 at 8:30 am .

Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Jury trial is scheduled for 9-21-22 at 8:30 am.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-15-22 at 10:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial date will remain on the Court's calendar until a plea is entered.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Motion For Joinder, filed.
filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Johnny Ray Lee not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for return on warrant.  Court cleared the bench warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set cash bail.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court set dates as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation (DISCHARGE - BENCH WARRANT)
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Status Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court with Attorney Fred Richardson for Attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned to 6-21-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
On Defense motion, Court ordered DV assessment dismissed.  Court will file an amended complaint.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant does not appear.  Court issued an arrest warrant REMAND back to Court Commissioner.

Defendant Johnny Ray Lee in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant appeared by zoom.  Case in court for an initial appearance.  Case needs to be heard in person.  Case is adjourned to 4-14-22 at 8:30 am for an initial appearance in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
